website_summaries.verdict: Helps four-legged friends stay cool at home or traveling. Heaven for your pets on a warm summer day.
pros: Soothes pets on contact for up to four hours
Can be used for dogs suffering various medical conditions
May be life-changing for dogs who dislike heat
Well-constructed and cool to human touch
cons: Must be stored flat to avoid creasing
Not good for pets who chew
Gel could harden after extended non-usage

customer_reviews.title: They say these pads are supposed to last for years ...
customer_reviews.text: They say these pads are supposed to last for years. Not so! I just pulled 3 pads out of the closet where they were stored over the winter and they are all wrinkled. They have shriveled up and have become unusable. They are less than 2 years old. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Shrinkage!!!
customer_reviews.text: This pad shrinks away from the sides and gets thinner over time even if stored in its box in a cool, dark place between uses. I only got one summer of use out of it before it became a shadow of the original product. My pets did enjoy it the first few months, so it might be useful if viewed as a disposable product that must be replaced annually. In the picture the tip of the measuring tape is touching the remaining gel to show the extent of the shrinkage. When I received the pad, the gel was much thicker and extended all the way to the edges. Poor shrunken pad.
customer_reviews.author: Casu Marzu

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $45
customer_reviews.text: This felt slightly cool upon opening it, but after my dogs laid on it for a while, it actually seemed to retain their body heat. It's also very thin. It had claimed to help with arthritis or joint pain, but I had to place it on top of the dog bed at night because it doesn't offer cushioning on its own. Sad. Had high hopes for this. I had it out on the porch to help combat the summer heat but the concrete was actually cooler than this.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Girl

customer_reviews.title: Defective after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: In less than a year, it's unusable. I folded the mat at set it aside for winter. After a couple months stored folded, it was rigid, like there was a plastic frame in the mat, and no longer cool to the touch. While it was in use during summer, the gel parts wrinkled, causing the mat to not lay flat. As shown in other reviews, the cooling pads inside the mat do not come close to the edge. Major disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: M Carter

customer_reviews.title: If you have a "big" dog like retrievers, large is not large enough for them ...
customer_reviews.text: My Cocker Spaniel girl loves this mat. I got 2 Large for her and put one (new version) in the living room and the other one (old version) in the bathroom. She can fully stretch her body on it. This is must for her every summary. Try the new & improved version. As someone mentioned. it is thicker and softer than the old version. Well, my Cocker girl loves both versions though. Be careful when choosing the mat size. If you have a "big" dog like retrievers, large is not large enough for them for sure. Large is good for Cocker Spaniel size.
customer_reviews.author: Roxy

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT STAY COLD FOR MORE THAN A COUPLE HOURS ...
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT STAY COLD FOR MORE THAN A COUPLE HOURS EVEN IF FROZEN ;((( VERY EXPENSIVE AND TOTALY INFERIOR PRODUCT, WE BOUGHT THE "WHALEK" COOLING MAT AND IT STAYS COLD FOR OVER 12 HOURS
customer_reviews.author: Jamie D

customer_reviews.title: 2 day lifespan👎
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves it, owner hates the quality! Ordered 7/1, received 7/5, ruined 7/7. I have a fluffer, with well maintained nails (not sharp or long) she’s not a chewer. In 2 days she basically shredded the outside material so much that I had to pick it up. Definitely not worth the money for 2 days use. If you have an x-lg dog do not purchase this product!
customer_reviews.author: Annie Gotte

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Despite advice from on-line reviewers, I could not get either of my small dogs to go anywhere near this. Or my cat. When I tried putting something they liked to eat on it, as advised, each animal just plucked the goody off and moved on. So, I have ended up using it myself! I put it under my shoulders and back when it's very hot, so I can attest that this thing works! Silly animals.Their loss.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope M

customer_reviews.title: Very minimal cooling, more of a texture than a relief
customer_reviews.text: Tried this first with one of our cats, and I think the fact they don't weigh much means they weren't activating the gel. Then tried with one of our dogs and the thermometer showed a few degrees cooler than ambient for about 30 minutes. Our dog and cat both seemed to like the texture of the pad which was a bit calming, but at the end of the day it seems like this really doesn't do much for the price. Looking up the listed US Patents, the advertising of the pad greatly overstates what the patents really claim to do (patents suggest the gel is very good at dispersing heat more than cooling below ambient temps).
customer_reviews.author: Ewan Grantham

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Can't figure this out. You can't have it in the heat at all or it turns hot. Its not comfortable. My Bichon's will choose else where over this pad. And if I get them to lay on it it turns hot under them. I would not recommend this pad. I think its a waste of money. All your pictures shows this pad in the sun and if you do lay it in the sun it gets very hot. This add is very misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Bonlynn

customer_reviews.title: Not fr my dogs!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for me...with my “power surges” most commonly known as hot flashes, I bought this to put on in between the sheets to help cool me off...it is such a “aaaaaahhhh” moment, by the time you fall asleep, it will warm up...and if you need to, just roll over a bit...very comfortable. I just purchased a second one for the couch where I usually sit..I bought the xl size, and it is quite heavy. I think I would have bought these when my kids were younger to use when they had fevers...can just put a towel on pad to regulate the initial coolness
customer_reviews.author: Be happy

customer_reviews.title: COOL
customer_reviews.text: We have an 11 yr old Boxer who cannot tolerate heat. With an unusually hot, late summer, i decided it was time for a cooling pad. When we received it, my dog sniffed it and then laid down beside it. With some coaxing (treats) I got him to lay on the pad after a walk. Now, as soon as we come back from our walks he gets water first and then heads right to the pad. It is sturdy, easy to clean and best of all it works as advertised. Will be purchasing a second pad for upstairs so I don't have to carry the one up and down the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Pam B

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well for my Golden
customer_reviews.text: This mat did not work for my golden retriever at all. She liked it for maybe two days, but it doesn't stay cool at all once you're on it. She would lay on it for about five minutes and you can feel how hot the pad is. When you first touch it, sure, it's cool to the touch and feels great on my own feet. Though maybe when she gets up and it's warm, it's actually a few degrees cooler than her body temp rather than the air temp. Regardless, can't return it because I tossed out the packaging and just kind of a waste. if your dog runs hot, it might not be enough to help cool them down.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Really Good! Keeps my pug cool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good product. I bought it a little bit bigger for my pet size, but it still does the job. They way it works is interesting and it does cool him. The only thing you have to take in consideration, is that if you have a crazy boy like my 4month old pug, you will need to use some treats to teach him to lay down and to stay there and most important for him not to think it is his pee pee pad. Maybe some dogs will get right away, mine didnt so I had to look for some treat training.
customer_reviews.author: Dio

customer_reviews.title: I wish my dog had tried this out before I ordered it.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted my old dog to like this pad, particularly when the temperature and humidity rises. However, right from the start he wouldn't voluntarily lie on the pad. At times I had to coax him onto it but he'd soon get up and leave. He'd do anything to avoid it, even walking around it. My 2 cats won't use the pad either. It's brand new and now useless to me. I'd like to return it but I got it in early May; it may be too late. I wish I'd tried it out before I spent so much $ on something that has no use, other than as a huge coaster.
customer_reviews.author: Reading to Cats

customer_reviews.title: Retriever loves it
customer_reviews.text: This has been amazing for our 8 year old 80 pound flat coated retriever. He has stopped pacing and panting looking for a cool place to lay down and utilizes the mat now that he understands what it’s for. So far it’s been durable and easy to move around the house. His claws aren’t very long so he can’t really scratch it up at all so it might hold up better for us.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Striggow

customer_reviews.title: (LARGE MAT) for a 65 lb Goldendoodle
customer_reviews.text: This is for size reference! We’ve had this product two days and so far so good. We have laid the mat by where he (@denver-rico) usually lays and he just kind of coincidentally laid on it. Now wherever it is he goes! I mean he must feel cooled off and comfortable on it since he likes it. His feet always hang off though which I think is fine but I think if your dog is any bigger than 65 lbs you should go with the XL size. It would be worth re-buying every couple summers or something if it doesn’t hold up. Just helping him stay cool a little longer in the crazy NY summer is just totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Montalvo

customer_reviews.title: Cools me a little more than my dog.
customer_reviews.text: Pros- Cool to the touch and dog searches it out when over heated. Can place in freezer for a few mins to get extra cold. Also works for humans during those hot summer nights ( put it under your feet). Hair, dirt and slobber are easily wiped off. Cons- For my dog who runs very hot, the mat only seems to stay cool for 30 mins at most- maybe it works better for average temperature dogs. This means that I get more use of it than my dog does and at this price I'm not sure that it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality!
customer_reviews.text: My dog, a 65 lb terrier mix, took about a month and half before he would even rest on this mat. Once he got use to it, he seems to enjoy it. However, today, when I went to wipe it off (for the first time) I noticed that the stitching on the side had come loose in an area. Since I have had it more than a month, the warranty is up. Wow! My dog doesn't tear at things, so he did not cause this. Clearly, it is poorly made. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Newtonian

customer_reviews.title: Only bed our sheltie ever uses!
customer_reviews.text: We bought several beds for our sheltie over the years, and he refused to go near any of them. I've had this mat for nearly a year now, and he uses it ALLLL the time. In fact, I'm on this site because I'm considering buying a 2nd one so I don't have to move his pad back and forth from his 'daytime' spot to his "nighttime" spot! We've had no problems with the pad getting hard or not working anymore. It does get used daily, and always indoors -- not sure if that makes a difference. He's always hot - lots of hair -- and he seems to truly love this mat!
customer_reviews.author: Susanne

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this bed!
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd took to this bed immediately. Warm Georgia summer is starting and he's got a lot of fur! I didn't think he'd figure it out so quickly, but he chooses this bed over his softer one whenever we come in from outside. I added a simple foam bathroom pad/rug under it to give more comfort. Easy to clean, but ours is starting to stain a bit from the dirt (we don't care). Not the best picture, but as you can see, he's comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: FarCoastFan

customer_reviews.title: Even Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the smaller size in case it didn't work but now I am so happy with this product I wish I got a bigger size! Originally it arrived on a super hot and was stuck in the mailbox for hours so it was very warm when unpackaged but it cooled down so quickly. My cats immediately took to laying on it for some relief and I stood on it a few times even to keep my feet cool! It doesn't get "freezing" cold but in 108 degrees it managed to stay cool enough for relief. Overall, it is very sturdy as my cats haven't even scratched it up and it is super soft to lay on for them.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn L

customer_reviews.title: No more hot spots!
customer_reviews.text: We have a golden retriever and he LOVES his cool pad. Won't even let us finish putting it down before he's trying to get on it. It's been a life saver this summer. He has hip displaisia and arthritis and has almost completely stopped limping. We no longer need to give him pain meds. He also gets really bad hot spots in the the summer and so far this summer, NONE! We put it in the fridge to get it colder. It lasts about 2 hours. We lay it down right before bed so he can sleep more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Britni Rosenbauer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The thing stays cool when unused. Not room temperature but cool to the touch. That is nice for my hairy German shepherd living in Florida. He doesn't use it unless I make him because it isn't a natural texture. I use this on his side of the bed and he usually just makes me sleep very awkwardly bc he won't use it. What's the texture like? Exactly how it smells.. like a giant ice pack.. doesn't smell like chemicals but when you touch it your hands smell like an ice pack. Pretty weird. Cool concept but my dog won't use it. Hopefully it grows on him over the summer
customer_reviews.author: K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: This one might call for a 'biscuit bribe' but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Got this mat for our 'big boy', a 90 lb. border collie mix. He's had problems with the calluses on his "elbows" because he likes to lay on the tile to cool off. Took about a week (and some dog biscuit bribes) to get him to use the mat, but now he loves it. And I love it too, since our vet visits will definitely reduce with the extra cushioning. He seems really comfortable on it. The reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is: 1, I can't say for sure how much it actually cools him down and, 2. although fairly sturdy, I can't tell how long it will last. Really happy with it, so far!
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: my cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after watching my cat moving around, lying on tiled surfaces, trying to cool down. I placed it in the bed on his cat tower. He didn't leave the bed for 2 whole days, except to eat, drink and use his litter box. I actually went searching for him a few times because he wasn't downstairs or in the garden like he usually is!. So far so good! Cat approves. I don't know how durable it will be. I've read reviews that say it shrinks when not in use. However, for right now, in this hot summer, it has been very useful and much appreciated by our feline friend.
customer_reviews.author: I love books

customer_reviews.title: Not What It's Supposed To Be
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dog for relief from our Florida summers. It's supposed to be cold. I have purchased other cold pads in the past that were so ice cold I had to put a towel over it so as not to get a cold burn. But this is barely cool. I don't know if this is just old stock and the materials inside are winding down (which they do in all of them after a year or two) or if their materials just aren't that good to start with. In any event, my experience is that it was a waste of money in that it's barely cool, let alone cold at all. Can't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Evening Iris

customer_reviews.title: Didn't cool at all
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of a low tech cooling mat. And since a heat wave was coming, I wanted something to help my cat. The mat arrived this morning. My cat didn't seemed impressed, so I tried the mat. I put a little pressure on it. Nothing at all. I tried a little more pressure all over the mat, and absolutely nothing happened. Not a hint of any kind of cooling. The mat remained as warm as it was coming out of its wrapper. I'm extremely disappointed, and I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Boston customer

customer_reviews.title: Ripped in under an hour
customer_reviews.text: Ripped in the first 30 min. I have a 70 pound golden retriever, claws trimmed I placed this on the floor he was checking out, feeling it with his paws and it ripped .. gel started oozing out, it was so thin, not like the picture and had little indents in several places from being folded. $50 and it didn’t even last an hour. I’m so disappointed ..
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Jean

customer_reviews.title: She likes it
customer_reviews.text: It took quite a while for my dog to get used to this mat, but she is using it now. My has laryngeal paralysis, that's a throat problem, that causes her to have trouble breathing. When she is laying someplace that's cool she stops panting. This mat has made her calm down and stopped her panting. It just takes time for them to get used to the mat. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JudiW

customer_reviews.title: Well, Our Dog LIkes It--Notices It
customer_reviews.text: Our 11 year old beagle female has thyroid and allergy issues and is sometimes on steroids or other meds that give her hot flashes. She tends to lay on the cool tile and frequently moves as she heats it up. So we got this to see if she'd be more comfy. It provides a little bit of padding, and eventually she figured it out and uses it as needed. Unfortuneatly, her litter mate brother remembers the "pee pads" he had as a puppy and well, you can imagine what he did...looks similar...I don't have to tell you. Luckily, his sister wasn't on it. So beware. But...does what is advertised; make take time.
customer_reviews.author: Fred V.

customer_reviews.title: DOESN’T WORK, NO INSTRUCTIONS
customer_reviews.text: This flat out doesn’t work and it was EXPENSIVE. And since it was a gift sent to Boston I can’t return it. I sent ie to my daughter in the next town over and hers didn’t work EITHER. TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.author: IVRN

customer_reviews.title: Our English Mastiff no longer wakes up in the middle of the night panting!
customer_reviews.text: Our English Mastiff would awaken us up panting in the middle of the night if the AC wasn't set on 71 degrees or lower. He's only had this mat for a couple of nights but hasn't woken up panting with the AC set at 72. (Previously, 72 was still too hot for him.) We are very happy that he's more comfortable and we're not awakened by his panting.
customer_reviews.author: A customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog likes this mat
customer_reviews.text: We live in Hawaii and my Border Collie does not like the heat. Her favorite place to lay is on the bathroom tile. I bought two of these gel mats. One for her travel crate and one for her regular crate. She seems to like them and I feel better knowing that she is laying on something cool which I know she prefers. With the cover they are easy to clean. Without it my first mat (different company but they look exactly the same), got pretty dirty with oil from her coat which I found hard to get out.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Do not use in hot weather
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cats in Arizona. Set it up and they used it the first night. By mid day it was too hot to touch for long. Reread the box. Do not use in hot conditions. I repeat, do not use the cooling pad in hot weather. Gave it 3 stars because if you live somewhere cool and you need to keep your pet cooler this might be good for you.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Happy Husky in California
customer_reviews.text: 45lb husky. Lg size. She loves crashing out on it. Only used indoors due to very wet spring but she is sleeping better and sleeps outside under the bushes less. Would have preferred XL but it’s rather more than we wanted to pay. Highly Reccommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pinto

customer_reviews.title: Happy times for a very furry boy
customer_reviews.text: We have a very furry breed, an Eurasier. He gets hot easily, and then moves around a lot. We've purchased 3 of these beds now, one for his favorite spot in the living room, one for his night-time kennel, and one for his soft-sided crate when we go on trips and the A/C is not that good in the back seat. He goes to these cooling pads all the time and they are his favorite places to lay. He's never chewed on the edges or scratched through the top, so we're very happy with the quality and functionality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer JH

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't function as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooling mat for my cat when he travels so he doesn't get overheated. The mat didn't even stay cool for 40 minutes. Also, it took more than an hour to recharge its cooling capability. Overall I was very disappointed with this purchase. It is a good idea, too bad it doesn't work as well as they claim it does.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Cat Lady

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use when traveling with my 10 lb Persian cat. With his long hair, his under carriage overheats no matter how much cold air you blow on his top side from the air conditioner. Worked great and kept him cool and comfortable on the road in his carrier. It did need to be recharged after about 3 hours, so we put it in the RV freezer for a bit and back under him for the last hour of our trip. If I'm traveling longer than 3 hours with him again, I will opt to get a second mat.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Well Made - Folds Easily For Storage - A Great Idea
customer_reviews.text: My dog has only used it three times and then only for short periods. Perhaps she's not warm enough or doesn't prefer the feeling so I covered it with a king pillowcase. She's like "meh - whatever." I'm certain she will come around. Like me, she's old and set in her ways. If she uses it, she uses it, if not then whatever. Not the manufacturers fault if I have a stubborn dog. Maybe I'll use it. :-) Update: She's using it more often and seems comfortable lying on it. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Knows - Usually :-)

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: After less than a month, this product is punctured, torn, and ruined. I trim my dogs nails regularly and it was still ruined by gentle use in less than a months time. Gel is spilling out of the mat, making it useless and dangerous for my dogs as I do not wish them to ingest this product. I wish I had heeded the warnings of other customers who had a poor experience with this product, I would not have purchased it, nor would I purchase it again. I am a single day outside the return policy or I would return it. Will never purchase this product again, nor will I purchase from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Norman

customer_reviews.title: No more hours of heavy panting for my Frenchie
customer_reviews.text: My French bulldog gets overheated quite a bit living in Texas. I have been searching for something to help cool my baby girl Leia down quickly. I just recieved the 20×30 mat today and it was perfect timing it was the hottest day of the year so far. She wasn't outside more than 15 minutes and she was so overheated she laid on the mat it WORKED!! IT COOLED my Frenchie down quickly! I love it so much I shared it on FB French bulldogs lovers. Comes it many sizes... Total game changer for Leia...
customer_reviews.author: An Artists with a purpose

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR BIG DOGS (even the XL size)
customer_reviews.text: This product might work well for smaller dogs, but it did not work well for my two 80 and 120 pound dogs (Pyrenees & Swiss Mountain). 1. The pad stays cool for about 20 minutes and becomes hot (indoors and not in direct sunlightper instructions). To the product's credit, it does recharge in about 20 minutes as advertised. 2. My dogs nails punctured the skin of the product with less than a month of use. The description of the XL size I bought says it is for dogs over 90 pounds. From what I can tell the XL size is the same thickness of gel and plastic protective skin as the smaller sizes. This is not adequate for large dogs.
customer_reviews.author: emilie getts

customer_reviews.title: Turned rock hard and unuseable
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Within 6 mo. the cooling pad turned rock hard and is now useless. I stored the item exactly as instructed on the box. There are no rips/tears in the material, so it's not that air got in. Would NOT purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Olivine

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t feel cool on my wood floor. Returned it
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t feel cool and my dog wouldn’t lay on it. So, I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Tampaslp

customer_reviews.title: Dog seems to approve.
customer_reviews.text: It does feel cool to touch, and the dog voluntarily uses in house (but not all time). However, I got it for the car, to help keep him cooler. Dont know if it makes huge difference, but makes me feel better knowing I've done what I can to keep him as comfortable as possible. I bring it in each day to help keep it cooler, too--not sure if it eould retain heat if left in car all day. I was ok w/color for car would prefer different color for home, but that's minor point really.I liked that this is the company with the patent pending (making others a knock-off)
customer_reviews.author: Crtclthinkr

customer_reviews.title: Better than the one made for humans!
customer_reviews.text: I actually got this for myself. It works like a charm and is less expensive than the ones made for humans. Just make sure you use it regularly or the gel will get hard and become unusable. That’s what happened to the more expensive one I had for a year. After I had stored it for several months, it couldn’t be used anymore because the gel got hard as a rock. This one gets just as cool and has an added plus that it can easily be folded in three.
customer_reviews.author: flaury

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: My 85 lb GSD fits perfectly on the large and loves it. She doesn't lay down for long periods of time so I am not worried that it gets warm after a while. I kept this on the end of my bed for the summer months (felt great on my legs too). Occasionally when I woke up I noticed that the mat seemed warm but it didn't seem to phase my dog. It's light blue so it looks dirty very quickly but that is to be expected, comes clean with warm soapy water. This mat has not popped, even when she had long nails and pawed at it. I will be purchasing another one if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Love This Thing!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 girls just love this mat. They will be panting like crazy and I'll just tell them "go lay on your cool mat"...they get right up and head over to get cooled off. It's really quite amazing. In fact, our daughter was visiting and is in the stage of her life that she has "personal summers" from time to time. She actually bought one and she has it under the sheets on her bed! She said it's a miracle! LOL I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: OzarkNana

customer_reviews.title: Slippery. Not good for older dogs.
customer_reviews.text: The product is cool to the touch. Folds so it is easily transportable. But the surface is very slippery. I bought it for my senior dog. And he can’t keep his balance on it. His feet slide out from under him. So I don’t recommend it for older dogs. Might be ok for young dogs.
customer_reviews.author: TLD

customer_reviews.title: Very slippery for old dogs
customer_reviews.text: We live in Colorado and our Malamute is 14yrs old and can't cool herself effectively. She wont lay on this Cool pad surface, she cannot stand up on it, it is so slippery even when dry. We purchased Norco frozen therapy packs, they are designed for use on a human back. They are about 12'' x 24", freeze in 2 hours and last for hours! We have 2 to rotate, and slip them into old pillow cases and they work great.. I am disappointed in the Cool Pad. It is not even as cold as concrete. I would not recommend to my family or friends to purchase this Cool Pad.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My 8 and 13 year young Golden doodles are always hot. I purchased one to try it (x-large) and my 8-yy Dood took to it immediately. As soon as he left,the other tried it, so I have now ordered a second one. We're going to use it in the car as we do a lot of road trips and it will help keep them cool if the car floor heats up. I also ordered the covers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog is coooool!
customer_reviews.text: I placed the mat on one side of kennel and allowed Chase (45lbs Standard Schnauzer) to choose where to sleep in these recent 80 degree temperature days. He actually chose the side with the mat and has used it regularly, I would say he likes it for designed purpose. I can't realistically address durability due to short period of usage. as for comfort Chase uses it during day. The big baby has to sleep next to bed at night with the air conditioning
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: My cat didn't care for it.
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't as attractive to my cats as I'd hoped. We bought it for a kitten, so the small size was enough. It wouldn't be big enough for a cat over 8 lbs, but it was enough for her little 4 lbs butt. I'd thought about buying one of the larger ones for our full grown cats, but our kitten didn't like it, so that's a no go. She decided she'd rather sleep on the tile instead. It's really just a pad, not a bed, and I think that was the deciding factor for her.
customer_reviews.author: LynxTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Big let down
customer_reviews.text: While we loved this mat for our basset hound and our border collie it only last three weeks. Now it won’t recharge and get cold at all. Of course now it’s outside my amazon return window so I’m stuck with a heavy pad that doesn’t cool. Bummer, big waste of money. I gave it two stars for durability, easy to clean and it’s comfortable for my pets.... have to give it zero stars for actually working.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Franklin

customer_reviews.title: This Cooling Matt works !
customer_reviews.text: I had to return Only because it would be too slippery on our marble floor. What I liked was this is the 1st cooling mat, I tried it myself, out of the box by kneeling on it & It most definately Did start to cool. If you're looking for a Cooling mat for your dog, this actually would work. No freezer, no mess & easy!! My dog didn't have a chance to try, I did. Im sure he would've loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Slicks girl

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but SO WORTH IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Pekingese loves this during the spring/summer/early fall. I rated it low on warmth because it helps to keep her cool. When it's really hot out I'll put in the fridge for 15-20 minutes and she will follow me to wherever I put it when she sees it in my hands. She really loves it and I have had it for over a year now, so I think it's super durable. Here is a pic from today 7-10-20, purchased 6-2-19. No tears, no rips, no holes, nothing!
customer_reviews.author: mailecat

customer_reviews.title: Chubby golden retriever loved it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for what turned out to be the final year of my golden retriever's life. She was a little (ok, maybe more than a little, in hindsight) chubby, and really felt the heat in the summertime. She also had sore joints towards the end, and this gave her some relief, for which I'm grateful. I'd give it a high recommendation, but from reading other reviews it sounds like it's a no-go if your dog might chew on it. I can only discuss our experience which was good, but not sure I'd buy it today knowing the problems other people have had.
customer_reviews.author: J. Arney

customer_reviews.title: Effective! (but not puncture resistant by any means)
customer_reviews.text: I have a Samoyed puppy with a double coat and even in the dead of Michigan winter, she is still hot. We put this on our bed and turn the fan on so that she will sleep with us instead of choosing to lay on the cool hardwood floor. It's definitely effective! I only wish that the material on it were more durable, as her little puppy teeth nearly punctured it when I looked away for 1 minute while she was hyper.
customer_reviews.author: Kat & Roux

customer_reviews.title: Already a cut in it from one of the dogs ...
customer_reviews.text: Already a cut in it from one of the dogs paws. Had it for a few weeks. Used Duct Tape to seal it. So far dog does not use it yet. Yesterday I wrote the previous review and now have two more cuts on surface. Dog has used it briefly. I will have to put some coating on it to protect it otherwise it will not be around for long. Could of been made of a stronger material for the money I paid for it. Glad I only bought one.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Luther

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my Golden Retriever because she really ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Golden Retriever because she really suffered through the hot Texas days. When it first came out of the box she wouldn't go near it - I assume because of the smell. A few days later (after it aired out) I coaxed her on it and now she loves it. She heads straight to when after she's been outside for awhile. After she's been on it for an hour or so it seems to lose it's coolness but it 'recharges' after another hour or so. This cooling pad does not have the sloshing sound that some less expensive ones do.
customer_reviews.author: EMF

customer_reviews.title: My Newfie likes it
customer_reviews.text: The newfie rescue recommended this product to me in lieu of a big dog bed. Newfies often like to just sleep on cold floors anyway. At first he ignored it, but I put it in front of the air conditioner and now he knows its HIS spot. He switches between this mat and the empty bathtub. I haven't really tried cleaning it, but it's getting a little dingy and I should try. It pushed up against a chair in one place and the material inside seemed to crumple or something, so it's probably not made to bunch up. I gave it a low rating for "warmth" because it is a cooling mat.
customer_reviews.author: Kalani Neeland

customer_reviews.title: Keeps English Mastiff Cool, Two Paws Up
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the largest size available for my 137lb English Mastiff. He is always hot. Where ever I put this mat he will lay on it to keep cool. Right now this one is in my office, but I will probably order one for my car and my house. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Q

customer_reviews.title: This Mat Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about the cooling technology when I purchased this, but even with the AC blasting in our house, my big mastiff/pyr mix was miserable in the heat and I had to try something. I'm not sure how, but this mat really works! It is cool almost immediately and is a great size. My kids grab it every time the dog isn't using it, and I must admit, I've tried it out on occasion as well.
customer_reviews.author: Perthenia Eilers

customer_reviews.title: Let your dogs figure out how they want to use this
customer_reviews.text: We have a Siberian husky and dealing with the heat is a constant issue with her. We bought this with the idea that it would replace her foam bed but it hasn't quite worked out that way. At first our girl didn't even like to go on the mat (she's generally suspicious of new things - toys, food, cooling mats, etc.). Over time we saw her use it more even as her bed sometimes. Now, she's figured out that she likes her old bed and likes to use cooling mat as her pillow. Whatever's clever, right?
customer_reviews.author: John Noh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, our dog loves laying on it.
customer_reviews.text: I’m guessing on the comfort but our dog gets hot easily even inside our air conditioned house at times. She used to go lay on our tiled floors but she figured out this would be a cool place to lay and knows when she needs to lay on it. She can be panting a lot and settles down pretty fast after laying on this. I just ordered a second one for our bedroom where she likes to sleep at night.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hartzler

customer_reviews.title: Product works very well
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes this thing. It actually works. If you step on it, it feels cold. It wicks away heat from the body like touching a piece of steel. I was skeptical. Its really easy to clean, doesn't stain. Sizes seem to run small. I happened to get the correct size though. Its not a cushion so I place a folded blanket under it. Either way my dog lays on it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Berneski

customer_reviews.title: Good in theory, but failed in reality.
customer_reviews.text: This product seems like a great idea in theory. In reality, it didn't work for us. I purchased for an outdoor stray cat. This pad stayed in the shade. Each day I tested the coolness of this pad. It didn't feel cool to my skin so I imagine it didn't feel cool to the cat either. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl9675

customer_reviews.title: My dog wouldn't go on it
customer_reviews.text: This may work great but not for my dog. My yellow lab who was having trouble with the heat didn't want to get on the plastic cover. She preferred our tile floor. Even when I used it in our kennel at night she didn't want to lie down. I had to put ice bags on her kennel and turn a fan on instead so she could lay on her soft dog cushion. My friend's Golden loves the Cooling Pad, though, so I gave it to that family and give it 3 stars. I guess it depends on your dog's sensitivities.
customer_reviews.author: Tumblewind

customer_reviews.title: Cooling Pad - Green Pet Shop
customer_reviews.text: Hello fellow K-9s, This is Haley Pug from Michigan. I gave four stars because this pad is extremely slippery so I hesitate to get on it. My couch (which is my favorite place to sleep) has a slight slope to it so I slide a little when I get on it. It does help stop my panting when I get to hot. Just be careful when first stepping on it. Woof, Woof Haley
customer_reviews.author: 2woofs

customer_reviews.title: Nice while it lasts!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loved this cooling pad until it simply evaporated or turned rock hard whatever it is that took place inside. I bought a second one for our RV and when I got it I noticed the first one was different because the new one weighed a lot more than the old one. Upon closer inspection I realized the older one was already shot. Lasted only seven months perhaps even less. I will not be buying another one. Very, very disappointing!!
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: This is a life saver in very hot weather
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved to a new home in a hot and humid environment. Our terrier was suffering terribly from the heat. We bought the large version of the pressure activated gel cooling mat and he immediately started sleeping on it at night. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Candace Lake

customer_reviews.title: A year later... :(
customer_reviews.text: I waited a year to write an update. It worked pretty good when it was brand new. I bought it to use on the back seat of my car, for my dog to be comfortable on our cross-country drive. I cleaned and stored it in provided pouch. Now it's getting warm, i pulled it out and it looks like the gel hardened. It's completely flat and hard. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Nouch196

customer_reviews.title: Our pets love it!
customer_reviews.text: We needed something for our two labs to cool off on at night in their crates. Immediately they took to the comfort. My biggest concern would be the mats being destroyed by our chewing labs. However, after several months they have not attempted to bite or chew on them. When our dogs are outside during the day our indoor cats will venture into the dogs crates and enjoy the comfort of the cooling mats. It appears most animals love these mats. I highly reccommend these mats. Been a good purchase for us.
customer_reviews.author: Mumford 11

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: My mat isn’t turning cool at all! I got it for my Pitbull; she’s 60 pounds and nothing happens when she lays on it. I’ve even sat on it, and I’m 170 pounds, and still nothing. SO disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lexy Nistico

customer_reviews.title: Happy Dog
customer_reviews.text: Second purchase on this product. My Newfoundland wore the first one out! It still cooled fine but had gotten a little ratty looking with all the use. It did take a little time for her to decide that it was good. I just left it in place and eventually she tried it. She loves it and uses it in weather that you wouldn’t think would require a cooling mat. I do wish that the EXL was a little bigger but this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: EmmPC

customer_reviews.title: are you kidding?
customer_reviews.text: did not work at all, i bought two of those and neither of them worked.. it was like i bought a very expensive mat.do not buy! just a waste of money..
customer_reviews.author: nedda

customer_reviews.title: It feels slightly cooler than my hand when I press ...
customer_reviews.text: It feels slightly cooler than my hand when I press on it however, it has not been any help to me because my dog refuses to sit, stand, or lay on it. I don't know why. I even folded it in half and placed it in his kennel so the pad took up 1/3 of the kennel floor, and he still lay where most of his body was not on the pad. This was in the garage when air temperature in 80s.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to beat the heat!
customer_reviews.text: My senior dog is a very big (and chubby), very black fella and is on prednisone, so he gets miserably hot in the summers. It’s a constant struggle to keep him cool. I’ve tried pupsicles, wading pools, personal fans, air conditioners, etc, and nothing has helped, he overheats all the time. This mat has been a god-send. This is the most relaxed he’s been since it warmed up! Only reason it got four stars is that I’m not a huge fan of the material they used—it’s great for cleaning but my poor fella slips and slides all over it. I wish they’d find some way to make it good for both.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah F.

customer_reviews.title: My dog is 11 years old and she gets hot easily. This Cooling Pet Pad was the perfect solution ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes to my Grandma's house 3 days a week and her house does not have A/C (in Sacramento where the temperature goes over 100 in summer). My dog is 11 years old and she gets hot easily. This Cooling Pet Pad was the perfect solution to cool her off. Thank you so much for creating an awesome pad!
customer_reviews.author: Masako Maupin

customer_reviews.title: I Would Sleep On This Mat If I Was Smaller
customer_reviews.text: My Golden, very furry, minds the Maryland spring/summer heat. I purchased this cooling pad 2 weeks ago based on the reviews. I could feel the coolness upon taking it out of the box. My husband said "she won't lay on it". Well, he's been proven wrong. We spend a lot of time outdoors and our dog took to this cooling pad right away. After 2 weeks of bringing it in at night, I just ordered a 2nd one so we can keep one outdoors and one indoors. Great invention. Very durable so far with no signs of wear, just some dirt spots which I wipe off. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Helps my dog cool down in Arizona heat
customer_reviews.text: It really works! I live in Arizona and my dog has trouble cooling off after walks (even in the Air conditioning). So I have him lay on this and he cools off within 10 minutes. Definitely getting another one if I ever need to.
customer_reviews.author: Goolagong

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a little over a year ago. It sorta still chill, but it has wrinkles, and it's no longer easy to clean. Decided to try out a different brand on my next order.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. B

customer_reviews.title: Check the size before use
customer_reviews.text: Returned the product; their QA dept totally missed this on the correct size. Fortunately it was very obvious that the measurements were wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Cook

customer_reviews.title: Meh, probably better options out there that last longer and are easier to clean
customer_reviews.text: First one had a hole and due to my job (Doctor) during the pandemic I didn’t get to return it. So I have that and the replacement around here. He uses it sometimes but the wood or tile floors must be cooler bc he prefers that. The fabric binding has also come off of each mat. There are probably better options for the money. When I have time I’ll get one of those and let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are a necessity for a cold loving dog!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these cooling mats for 6 years. Harley lives on his 2 mats. Yes they are very durable & washable; but every year I purchase 2 new mats. I will never forget the very first mat I purchased I stepped on it & could not believe how cold they are. If you have a cold loving dog - Newfoundland, Husky, Malamute, etc., etc. these are a must. They work exactly as advertised! They only need 20 minutes to recharge themselves & they are cold once again.
customer_reviews.author: Newfy Mom

customer_reviews.title: This one works
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE! (minus 4 stars!) rock hard! very unhappy. it's shriveled up and unusable. we got about 16 months usage out of it. BEWARE! Doggo loves it. Seems to be holding up well to the abuse the dog puts it through; he paws the bed before lying upon it and this has scratch marks on it, but has not ruptured, torn or otherwise leaked. Once the dog figured out what it was, he won't move from it on hot days. This is our second pad, the first one was a different brand and didn't last very long. Fingers crossed, we've only had this a couple of months (and none of them summer) but will update if something changes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... being in wardrobe it is shrinked and very hard like rock.
customer_reviews.text: Very disapointed as after being in wardrobe it is shrinked and very hard like rock....
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Schor

customer_reviews.title: Not for dogs who like to scratch
customer_reviews.text: My dog ripped this cooling pad within an hour. He scratched at it, like he does most of his beds, before he lied down. The seam had ripped and the gel was coming out of the side. I don’t know if the bed actually works, but I’m only giving it 1star for durability.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Fingers crossed!
customer_reviews.text: So. I literally got this a few days ago. The primary purpose is for our dog to use on our boat during the hot summer months. The attached pics are of me trying it out at home. He seems interested. I did have the opportunity to try it on our boat this past weekend. Although it’s not quite sweltering yet, I’m not sure my dog has figured out it’s purpose. But I hope In time the realization will hit him and I won’t have to spend all summer worrying he is too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki S

customer_reviews.title: Such a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to receive this product, but it was not what I expected. It never seemed to really cool my dog down, and ultimately she found more comfort trying to lay on the wood floor to cool down. But what's worse, the product completely hardened and we have had it less than a year. It is rock hard, despite having stored it according to instructions. And they will not offer a refund or replacement. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Becca S.

customer_reviews.title: Still works perfectly!!for 90 pound HOT Rottweiller
customer_reviews.text: It’s been in the 90s with 90% humidity here, my AC Has been down. My 90 pound Rottweiler stopped panting for the first time in 3 days a few minutes after he laid down on the pad. I HIGHLY recommend this product. FIVE STARS. Grandma WOOWOO
customer_reviews.author: Grama WooWoo

customer_reviews.title: Large vs. XL Large Size
customer_reviews.text: I have a 75 lb APBT. Going by the size chart I ordered size large. Even though her torso did fit on the large mat, it was not wide enough for her entire body with little room to spare height wise as well. I replaced with the XL size (image attached to my review is XL size) which has a lot more room. The quality of the product is very good and it works as described for cooling.
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: My dog avoids it like the plague
customer_reviews.text: My dog is being white trash af. I spent $50 on this Matt and she won’t even both with it. I know we both came from humble beginnings but dang, I’m just trying to keep her cool during the summer and she prefers a damp towel on the tile floor. She’s about a 40lb 5 month old golden retriever and we got the Large which is almost too small for her.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Measure your dog first before choosing the size
customer_reviews.text: The medium size isn’t big enough for my Pomeranian. The description can’t be right as it says the medium is good for 15-35lb dogs. My 15lb dog is too big for this. It does work perfectly however but defeats the purpose. I admit I should have measured it myself to see if it would suit my dog but I’m kinda of disappointed with the description as I was in a hurry and went with that instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jia

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness
customer_reviews.text: Our 13 yr 70 pd Labrador baby was overheating. We got the xl, we fold it into her carriage, put it in the backseat of the car, on the couch at night...thank God for things that work!
customer_reviews.author: FrogQueen

customer_reviews.title: N/A
customer_reviews.text: DURING THE SUMMER DAYS WHERE IT IS QUITE HOT OUTSIDE, OUR DOG LIKES TO LAY ON THIS TO KEEP HER NICE AND COOL. DIDN'T TAKE LONG FOR HER TO START USING IT EVERY DAY THAT IT IS HOT OUTSIDE. MAT MUST BE PLACED ON SOMETHING SOLID LIKE A WOOD OR TILED FLOOR. DOESN'T WORK WELL ON A DOG BED OR CARPET BECAUSE THE MAT TENDS TO WARM UP
customer_reviews.author: Darin

customer_reviews.title: Cool little bed
customer_reviews.text: Due to health concerns, my kitty is crated when he's alone. One thing I noticed was that he had no appetite on very warm days, and if he doesn't eat, his blood sugar is unstable. I added this little pad underneath one of his beds in the crate, and he has added it to his rotation. So far this summer, his appetite has remained decent. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: kristinab

customer_reviews.title: It really does stay cool for a lomg period of time.
customer_reviews.text: It is heavy,really surprised me cause it looks so thin. I purchased for my lab that has arthritis in her legs. It took her 3 to 4 days to warm up to the idea of laying on it. But now she is on it everyday multi times a day. I swear it is helping her feel better. I would Highly recommend this for your dog!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good product
customer_reviews.text: After seeing all the hype and good reviews I decided to try this product. It does stay cool but not very cool and it is certainly not weight activated
customer_reviews.author: David Clanton

feature_bullets: THE ORIGINAL SELF COOLING GEL PAD FOR DOGS – The Green Pet Shop pressure-activated cooling pet mat provides chilled relief for your dogs and cats. It's the perfect solution if your pet struggles to stay cool and comfortable in the summer weather

IT'S AUTOMATIC – No effort from you is required. This self cooling pet pad works without water, electricity or refrigeration. The patented gel formula automatically recharges after 15-20 minutes of non-use. This is a must-have item if your home doesn't have air conditioning

PERFECT FOR HOT SUMMER DAYS – Lay the dog cooling pad where your furry friend likes to relax. Once they lay on the pad, it goes to work immediately. Cool to the touch, the chilled sensation offers immediate relief. It's ideal for senior animals or pets with medical conditions

MULTI-USE AND PORTABLE – Use it on the floor, sofa, or place it in your pet's crate, bed or kennel. The cooling pads are lightweight and folds effortlessly, ideal for travel. Clean with a damp cloth as needed

LARGE DOG COOLING PAD – This pet cooling gel mat measures 23.6 x 36 inches, for large dogs weighing between 65-90 lbs. Other sizes are available. Do not leave in direct sunlight as this will affect the performance of the cool pad
